oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery On The Record with Brooks and Dunn - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Brooks and Dunn (performance group) for Ralph Emery: On the Record With Brooks and Dunn. Recording is performed in front of a live audience. Interview features a segment featuring Merle Haggard (performer). Recording is from May 02, 1995. Tape is labeled part 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Brooks and Dunn
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Ralph Emery inquires as to why Ronnie Dunn was opposed to a meeting with Merle Haggard, and Haggard recalls when he met Lefty Frizzell -- (01:50) Haggard recalls a time Elvis Presley wished to meet Haggard and Bonnie Owens -- (03:07) Emery and Haggard joke and say goodbye -- (04:10) Emery reflects on how Garth Brooks was intimidated to meet George Jones; additionally Dunn and Kix Brooks talk about wanting to get Haggard to sign Dunn's guitar -- (06:27) Emery invites Dunn to reflect on his family -- (08:39) Emery invites Brooks and Dunn to reflect on song-writing successes before the duo formed -- (10:16) I'm Only in it For the Love [excerpt] (John Conlee) -- (11:00) Emery recalls Dunn's successful writing career, and Dunn discusses winning the Marlboro Country Showdown -- (13:32) Holed Up in Some Honky Tonk [excerpt] (Ronnie Dunn) -- (14:25) Emery addresses the crowd during the commercial break -- (16:03) Emery, Brooks and Dunn discuss how "Holed Up in Some Honky Tonk" helped Dunn's career; additionally, Brooks and Dunn's susceptibility to criticism is discussed -- (18:58) Brooks and Dunn reflect on difficulties of unfair criticism and cancelling a show -- (21:19) Emery inquires about the amount of staffing needed to produce a Brooks and Dunn show -- (22:34) Emery questions what the 'Metal Rodeo' is -- (24:09) Emery plays a video of Brooks and Dunn practicing for the 'Metal Rodeo' -- (25:56) Emery, Dunn and Brooks joke about Dunn hitting Brooks with his vehicle -- (29:01) Emery inquires about, Brooks and Dunn's other interest, shirts -- (29:50) Emery asks about the touring schedule of Brooks and Dunn; additionally, Emery inquires about the similarities of Brooks and Dunn to different genre artists -- (30:46) Emery, Brooks, and Dunn complement each other and say their goodbyes
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Brooks & Dunn (Musical group); Brooks, Kix; Dunn, Ronnie; Haggard, Merle; Haggard, Merle, 1937-2016;
